comments:
In the RC2 build the Tomcat JUnit tests logged an error when creating a Web
module. It didn't appear to affect the outcome, so the module must have been
created well enough to use API and execute. However, this should probably be
caught (and maybe logged as a warning if needed) instead of thrown as an
exception. I've included the code and stack trace below:

IDataModel dataModel = DataModelFactory.createDataModel(
   new WebComponentCreationDataModelProvider());
dataModel.setProperty(IComponentCreationDataModelProperties.
   COMPONENT_NAME, WEB_MODULE_NAME);
dataModel.setBooleanProperty(
   IJ2EEComponentCreationDataModelProperties.ADD_TO_EAR, false);
dataModel.setIntProperty(IJ2EEComponentCreationDataModelProperties.
   COMPONENT_VERSION, 22);
dataModel.getDefaultOperation().execute(new NullProgressMonitor(), null);


Output:
